notes.text: ATTENTION: Remotely exploitable/low skill level to exploit
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: ICS-CERT recommends that users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: ICS-CERT reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: ICS-CERT also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available in the ICS -CERT Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies, that is available for download from the ICS-CERT web site.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to ICS-CERT for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target these vulnerabilities.
notes.title: Exploitability

revision_history.summary: ICSA-17-019-01 Schneider Electric homeLYnk Controller Cross-site Scripting
ICSA-17-019-01A Schneider Electric homeLYnk Controller (Update A)

product.name: homeLYnk Controller LSS100100: all versions prior to V1.5.0

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: The homeLYnk controller is susceptible to a cross-site scripting attack. User inputs can be manipulated to cause execution of java script code.CVE-2017-5157 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.3 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Schneider Electric has made firmware that fixes these vulnerabilities available for download

For more information on these vulnerabilities and more detailed mitigation instructions, please see Schneider Electric security notification SEVD-2017-011-01 and security notification SEVD-2017-052-02

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command ('Command Injection')

notes.text: The homeLYnk controller has network features that can be manipulated via specially crafted POST requests. This vulnerability requires user interaction to be exploited.--------- Begin Update A Part 2 of 2 -------
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Schneider Electric has made firmware that fixes these vulnerabilities available for download

For more information on these vulnerabilities and more detailed mitigation instructions, please see Schneider Electric security notification SEVD-2017-011-01 and security notification SEVD-2017-052-02
